author: Stephanie Bedard-Chateauneuf
title: Laid Off in the U.S.? You May Get a Raise If You’re Claiming Unemployment
description: The extension to unemployment insurance will give an extra $600 per week to every worker, which means low-wage workers might get a raise. The post Laid Off in the U.S.? You May Get a Raise If You’re Claiming Unemployment appeared first on CCN.com
content:
• As the coronavirus pandemic is causing many shutdowns, a record number of workers have been laid off.
  • An extension to unemployment insurance will give $600 to every U.S. worker for four months.
